channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Markets wobble after Trump threatens Canada with 35% tariff over alleged ‘flow of Fentanyl’
item.description: The S&P 500 fell 0.33%, the Nasdaq dropped 0.23%, and the Dow dipped 0.63%.

item.title: Exclusive: Crypto and stablecoin infrastructure startup Zerohash to raise $100 million at an almost $1 billion valuation
item.description: The company is the latest beneficiary of venture capital’s booming interest in stablecoins.

item.title: Immigration Arrests in Los Angeles Spike Amid Aggressive Enforcement
item.description: Nearly 3,000 people have been arrested since the beginning of June, more than three times the number in previous months this year.

item.title: Son of El Chapo Pleads Guilty to Sweeping Drug Charges
item.description: The plea came at a vulnerable moment for the Sinaloa drug cartel, the organization Ovidio Guzmán López’s father helped found.

item.title: Jamie Dimon breaks with ‘idiots’ in Democratic Party, saying they ‘have big hearts and little brains’
item.description: "They do not understand how the real world works," said the JPMorgan Chase CEO. "Almost every single policy rolled out failed."

item.title: California pampers its chickens and Americans pay the price, Trump argues in new DOJ lawsuit
item.description: The DOJ lawsuit blames California's animal welfare laws for soaring egg prices. Activists cry bird flu.

item.title: ‘Buy the Dip’ Wins Again for Stock Investors
item.description: Individual investors were the ones who piled into stocks when they plunged in early April, while big Wall Street institutions missed out on the gains.

item.title: The exclusivity on OpenAI’s $3 billion acquisition for AI coding startup Windsurf has expired
item.description: Windsurf is now free to explore other options.

item.title: Before the Central Texas Floods, the Owners of Camp Mystic Were a Fixture
item.description: For decades, Dick and Tweety Eastland presided over Camp Mystic with a kind of magisterial benevolence that alumni well past childhood still describe ...

item.title: David Gergen, Washington Veteran Who Advised Four Presidents, Dies at 83
item.description: After serving in the government, he became a prominent political commentator. “Centrism doesn’t mean splitting the difference,” he said in 2020.

item.title: Want to Understand Russia? Visit Dubai.
item.description: It’s a key refuge for Moscow’s wealthy, including the record producer Iosif Prigozhin. He insists he still loves President Vladimir V. Putin, no matte...

item.title: Evidence Supports War Crimes Allegations in Darfur, I.C.C. Prosecutor Says
item.description: The International Criminal Court has “reasonable grounds to believe” war crimes and crimes against humanity were committed, the court’s deputy prosecu...

item.title: Appeals Court Overturns Plea Deal in 9/11 Case
item.description: The court found that Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III had the authority to invalidate a contract reached between the accused mastermind and a Pen...

item.title: Trump’s Latest Canada Tariff Threats Come Despite Cordial Negotiations With Carney
item.description: The country’s new prime minister, Mark Carney, has been called the “Trump whisperer,” and negotiations have been cordial and professional. But it’s be...

item.title: Trump Says NATO Countries Will Buy Weapons to Give to Ukraine
item.description: If the plan is finalized, it would allow critical aid to flow to Ukraine as it endures one of Russia’s heaviest assaults of the war.
